topProducts.name: Smothered Chicken
topProducts.description: A chicken dish, also served as a sandwich with red sauce and coleslaw, praised as being 'delicious' and 'fabulous'.
quotes: I absolutely adored the smothered chicken sandwich, which is served with red sauce and coke slaw
The smothered chicken and fried yucca is the key to my heart
I recommend the smothered chicken (it's so moist) or the pork bowl

topProducts.name: Pulled Pork
topProducts.description: Slow-cooked, tender pork, available as a sandwich with pickles and green sauce or as a main dish.
quotes: We had the pulled pork sandwich, which is served with pickles and green sauce
We enjoyed the pulled pork sandwich and the chicken gumbo

My sandwich
was wonderful, the pulled pork was tender and juicy, and the fried plantains were perfect

topProducts.name: Fried Sweet Plantains
topProducts.description: Caramelized and sweet fried plantains, served as a side dish or appetizer with a green dipping sauce.
quotes: We started with the fried sweet plantains, really caramelized and yummy

topProducts.name: Yucca Fries
topProducts.description: Fried yucca, served as a side dish and described as being highly enjoyable.
quotes: Ordered chicken chilaquiles verde with a side of yucca fries and fried plaintains

topProducts.name: Collard Greens
topProducts.description: A classic side dish, mentioned as being particularly delicious.
quotes: Collard greens were delicious as well as the smoked beef
The collard greens with smoked chicken are my favorite side; they put most other collards to shame
Their collard greens were 10/10 and the best I’ve had from any restaurant

topProducts.name: Smoked Beef
topProducts.description: A smoked beef dish noted for its high quality and flavor, considered a standout in the local area.
quotes: Collard greens were delicious as well as the smoked beef

topProducts.name: Piri Piri Chicken
topProducts.description: A chicken special that received a '10/10' rating in a review.

topProducts.name: Sangria
topProducts.description: A wine-based drink that is specifically recommended by a reviewer.
quotes: Make sure to order a sangria
Do wish sangria on menu would actually be available

highlightedReviews.author: Thomas Atkinson
highlightedReviews.text: I'm not sure how or why I haven't eaten at Brasa until yesterday afternoon, but what an excellent lunch.  Seated outside, we ordered using the QR code to pull up the menu, order and pay.  Lot's of selections and a very easy method to order.  In a matter of what seemed like a minute or two, our drinks were delivered followed shortly thereafter by our food.  The food was excellent.  I ordered the Chilaquiles topped with a sunny side up fresh farm egg and my friend ordered a sandwich that came with chips.  10 out of 10s.  The chicken in my chilaquiles was most and plentiful.  The bright golden yoke egg was a nice addition.  His sandwich was made with an excellent roll and the meat had a great smokey flavor.  We skipped the chips so I can't comment on the same...though they were part of my dish, smothered in verde sauce.  I will be back...soon.

highlightedReviews.author: Linda McLoon
highlightedReviews.text:
I forgot how truly delicious the food is at Brasa. I needed to pick up food for an event, and decided to get take out.

We started with the fried sweet plantains, really caramelized and yummy. They are served with an interesting green dipping sauce. Lovely. We had the pulled pork sandwich, which is served with pickles and green sauce. The meat was so tender, and the accomplishments really complemented the pork. I absolutely adored the smothered chicken sandwich, which is served with red sauce and coke slaw. My goodness - this was DELICIOUS! They both came with house made tortilla chips - these were just as yummy the next day!

I enjoyed the butterscotch pudding also. The only slightly negative note was the chocolate cake, which was dry despite the whipped cream and topping.

I heartily recommend Brasa, in particular that fabulous smothered chicken!!

You can eat in, or order for takeout also.

highlightedReviews.author: Lake Katrina
highlightedReviews.text:
One of our family favorites whenever we go through Minneapolis! The food is always fantastic, authentic & fresh!!!
I always go with a BOWL! I recommend the smothered chicken (it's so moist) or the pork bowl! Everytime we go I buy a hot vinegar to take home as well. Brasa would easily be a 5 star place but the recent move to QR code orders is a bit frustrating.

highlightedReviews.author: Venita S
highlightedReviews.text: Dad came to visit us in Minneapolis from Florida. Brought him in for a surprised birthday dinner here. Everyone from the host, cashier, and servers is so attentive and full of great positive energy! Jacob - one of the most amazing servers that I ever met really made my day and made this birthday surprise above and beyond special! Thank you so much! We will recommend your restaurant to friends and family :)

highlightedReviews.author: Andrew Butterbrodt
highlightedReviews.text: Have loved eating here and getting takeout for years. Recently picked up an order when coming back into town from a camping trip and my wife remarked how this is the best takeout around and always satisfies. Leftovers keep well too so it’s just as good the next day. The collard greens with smoked chicken are my favorite side; they put most other collards to shame. Douse them (and your chips) with the hot pepper vinegar to really make them great.

highlightedReviews.author: Mika Baer
highlightedReviews.text:
The menu is rooted in Southern and Caribbean-inspired flavors, and everything is made with care. My personal go-to is the pulled chicken, which is juicy, tender, and perfectly seasoned. Pair it with the creamed jalapeño spinach - a side dish so unexpectedly addictive that I now find myself ordering it every time, no matter what else I get.

The atmosphere is casual and welcoming, with a laid-back counter-service setup that somehow still manages to feel intentional and warm. It’s the kind of place where regulars bring newcomers, knowing the food will speak for itself.

Other favorites include the slow-roasted pork, collard greens, and desserts. They are all flavorful, filling, and made to be mixed, matched, and shared. The portions are generous, and there are great options for gluten-free and dairy-free diners, too.

Brasa doesn’t try to be trendy or overcomplicated. It focuses on doing comfort food right. With quality ingredients, bold flavor, and heart, if you’re looking for a meal that hits all the right notes without trying too hard, this is it.

@foodiemsp on Instagram

highlightedReviews.author: Tor Swanson
highlightedReviews.text: Great chicken, great pork. Acceptable plantains. Accepting that everyone has bad days, my experience with the wait staff was that they seemed somewhat annoyed that I had come there for a meal. Everything was correct, and brought to the table quickly, so mechanically the server was good. They just had a little more disdain for customers than I prefer.

highlightedReviews.author: Rochelle Becker
highlightedReviews.text: The entire menu looks amazing!  It was hard to choose!  Ordered chicken chilaquiles verde with a side of yucca fries and fried plaintains.  The green sauce is so incredibly good.  Everything was cooked perfectly.  Service was great!  Attentive but not overbearing.  Atmoshere was busy but not distracting or unpleasant! Absolutely will stop here anytime I am in town!!!

highlightedReviews.author: Shalon Johnson
highlightedReviews.text: Hidden gem! I came here for the 1st time last week for a staff meeting. Upon arriving, everyone was extrmelely friendly. We were seated immediately and given menus to review. I ordered the rotisserie chicken with Yuca fries, Mac and cheese, and cornbread. Everything arrived very quickly. I’ve been to numerous restaurants, and the wait time here was almost non-existent. The food came out within 5 to 7 minutes of ordering. The waiter was extremely attentive and continuously returned to see how we were doing and checked in to see how everything tasted. The rotisserie chicken I ordered with the green sauce was phenomenal. The mac and cheese and everything else was exceptional. I would definitely return. I had a really great experience and the environment was very welcoming.

highlightedReviews.author: Phil Domek
highlightedReviews.text:
Simple and comfortable atmosphere with a lot of natural light. Our wait person was wonderful, having a pleasant and down to earth personality combined a great sense of humor.  My sandwich
was wonderful, the pulled pork was tender and juicy, and the fried plantains were perfect. All combined; the staff, the food,  and amosphere made for a great afternoon experience.
